newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Tan Chong to raise vehicle output.
newsitem.headline: Tan Chong to raise vehicle output.

text.p: Tan Chong Motor Holdings Bhd said on Friday it plans to double the output of three popular Nissan Motor Co Ltd models to 1,400 units a month by end-1997.
"We hope to double production by the end of the year," said Tan Chong's deputy managing director Tan Hoe Pin.
"We first have to upgrade our facilities and get the workers," he added.
Tan said the company, which also sells Nissan vehiclesin Malaysia, would assemble more Cefiro saloon cars, Serena mini-vans and Terrano four-wheel drives.
The three models which were launched last year and have become so popular that buyers must wait five to nine months for delivery, Tan said.
Including other Nissan vehicles, the company assembles 2,000 vehicles a month in Malaysia.
Higher production volume would reduce waiting periods and help offset the appreciation of the Japanese yen against the ringgit, company officials said after the firm's annual meeting.
But Tan Chong managing director Tan Eng Soon said the company was not too concerned with the appreciation of the yen against the ringgit as unit costs were still below last year's.
